com.sponsorpay.publisher.mbe

Class SPBrandEngageClient

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.sponsorpay.publisher.mbe.SPBrandEngageClient

  • public class SPBrandEngageClient
extends Object

    Provides methods to request and show BrandEngage offers and notifies its listener SPBrandEngageClientStatusListener of changes in the status of the engagement.

    Before requesting offers, make sure the have called the SponsorPay.start(String, String, String, Activity) method. At this point you can determine if offers are available with requestOffers(com.sponsorpay.credentials.SPCredentials, Activity). When the engagement is over you must restart the process, querying if offers are available, before you run any engagement again. To check for new virtual coins earned by the user, given you've set your VCS key with the SponsorPay.start(String, String, String, Activity), simply set a SPCurrencyServerListener using setCurrencyListener(SPCurrencyServerListener) and it will be notified after a successful engagement. Note - Offer availability (requestOffers(com.sponsorpay.credentials.SPCredentials, Activity)) cannot be requested while an engagement is running. Call canRequestOffers() if you're not sure that this instance is in a state in which a request for offers is possible.

    • Method Detail

      • requestOffers

        public boolean requestOffers(SPCredentials credentials,
                    Activity activity)
        Queries the server for BrandEngage offers availability. Offer availability cannot be requested while an engagement is running or the server is currently being queried. Call canRequestOffers() if you're not sure that this instance is in a state in which a request for offers is possible.
        Parameters:
        credentials - The credentials that will be used for this query.
        activity - The calling activity
        Returns:
        true if a request is being made, false otherwise
        See Also:
        SPCredentials, SponsorPay.start(String, String, String, Activity)

      • startEngagement

        public boolean startEngagement(Activity activity)
        Starts running an available engagement.
        Parameters:
        activity - The activity that will be used to show the engagement
        Returns:
        true if the engagement can be started

        Returns:

      • shouldShowRewardsNotification

        public boolean shouldShowRewardsNotification()
        Returns:

        See Also:

      • setParametersForRequest

        public boolean setParametersForRequest(Map<String,String> parameters)
        Sets the additional custom parameters used for this mbe request. It's intended to be used only within the SDK's scope and explicitly from the getIntentForMBEActivity methods. Use the setCustomParameters to set manually the custom parameters
        Parameters:
        parameters - The additional parameters map
        Returns:
        true if successful in setting the parameters, false otherwise

        true if successful in setting the listener, false otherwise
